skill.name: nano-image-generator
skill.description: Generate images using Nano Banana Pro (Gemini 3 Pro Preview). Use when creating app icons, logos, UI graphics, marketing banners, social media images, illustrations, diagrams, or any visual assets. Supports reference images for style transfer and character consistency. Triggers include phrases like 'generate an image', 'create a graphic', 'make an icon', 'design a logo', 'create a banner', 'same style as', 'keep the style', or any request needing visual content.

security_audit.summary: The skill is a legitimate image generation tool using Google's Gemini API. It makes network calls only to the official Google API endpoint, validates user inputs, and handles files safely. The only security concern is that API keys are hardcoded in the script rather than using environment variables.

low_findings.title: API key hardcoded in source code
low_findings.description: The Gemini API key is stored directly in the get_api_key() function at line 45. While documented as a setup requirement, this is less secure than using environment variables and could lead to accidental key exposure if the file is shared.

content.user_title: Generate AI images with Gemini 3 Pro
content.value_statement: Create stunning visuals for your projects without design skills. This skill uses Google's Gemini 3 Pro to generate images from text descriptions, supporting style transfer and character consistency through reference images.
actual_capabilities: Generate images from text prompts using Gemini 3 Pro API
Support up to 14 reference images for style transfer
Automatic file format detection and correct extension assignment
Batch processing with consistent style across multiple images
limitations: Requires manual API key configuration in the script file
Maximum 14 reference images per generation request
Text rendering in images may be imperfect
Gemini API rate limits and usage costs apply

use_cases.title: Create app icons and screenshots
use_cases.description: Generate professional app icons, feature graphics, and store screenshots in required dimensions and styles.

use_cases.title: Design social media graphics
use_cases.description: Create eye-catching posts, banners, and thumbnails for platforms like Instagram, YouTube, and blogs.

use_cases.title: Maintain visual consistency
use_cases.description: Use reference images to ensure consistent style across a series of illustrations or marketing materials.

prompt_templates.title: Basic image generation
prompt_templates.prompt: Generate an image of [subject] with [style] style, [colors] colors, for [purpose]

prompt_templates.title: Style transfer
prompt_templates.prompt: Create [new subject] with the same visual style as the reference image, maintaining [specific elements]

prompt_templates.title: Character consistency
prompt_templates.prompt: The same character from the reference image, now [new scene/activity], keep appearance identical

prompt_templates.title: Multi-image fusion
prompt_templates.prompt: Combine the [style/subject] from first reference with [style/subject] from second reference

output_examples.input: Generate a minimalist app icon for a meditation app with purple gradient
output: Style: Minimalist with purple gradient background

best_practices: Be specific in prompts: include style, colors, composition, and purpose
Use reference images for consistent style across multiple generations
Choose appropriate aspect ratios for your use case (1:1 for icons, 16:9 for banners)
anti_patterns: Don't request complex text in images - overlay text separately for better results
Avoid vague prompts like 'make it nice' - specify what you want
Don't exceed 14 reference images - the API has a hard limit

faq.question: Is this compatible with all Claude versions?
faq.answer: Yes, works with Claude, Claude Code, and Codex that support skill installation.

faq.question: Can I use this with my existing design workflow?
faq.answer: Yes, output standard image formats (PNG, JPG, WebP) compatible with all design tools.

faq.question: Is my API key secure?
faq.answer: The key is stored in the script file. Keep it private and consider using environment variables for production.

faq.question: Why is my image generation failing?
faq.answer: Check API key configuration, internet connection, and ensure prompts comply with Gemini's content policy.

faq.question: How does this compare to other image generators?
faq.answer: Uses Google's Gemini 3 Pro Preview with superior reference image handling and style consistency.
